html: The business of prophets was both to preach and pray. In this chapter, I. The prophet determines to apply closely and constantly to this business, Isaiah 62:1. II. God appoints him and others of his prophets to continue to do so, for the encouragement of his people during the delays of their deliverance, Isaiah 62:6. III. The promises are here repeated and ratified of the great things God would do for his church, for the Jews after their return out of captivity and for the Christian church when it shall be set up in the world. 1. The church shall be made honourable in the eyes of the world, Isaiah 62:2. 2. It shall appear to be very dear to God, precious and honourable in his sight, Isaiah 62:3-5. 3. It shall enjoy great plenty, Isaiah 62:8. 4. It shall be released out of captivity and grow up again into a considerable nation, particularly owned and favoured by heaven, Isaiah 62:10-12.
